content.body:
### Response data | Index | Field | Type | Description | | :------- | :----- | :----------------------- | :--------------------------------------------------------- | | \[0...n] | WALLET | [Wallet](#wallet-arrays) | Each index contains one of the `n` current user's wallets. | #### Wallet arrays | Index | Field | Type | Description | | ----- | ---------------------- | ------ | ------------------------------------------------------- | | \[0] | TYPE | string | Wallet name (exchange, margin, funding) | | \[1] | CURRENCY | string | Currency (e.g. USD, BTC, ETH, ...) | | \[2] | BALANCE | float | Balance | | \[3] | UNSETTLED\_INTEREST | float | Unsettled interest | | \[4] | AVAILABLE\_BALANCE | float | Wallet balance available for orders/withdrawal/transfer | | \[5] | LAST\_CHANGE | string | Description of the last ledger entry | | \[6] | LAST\_CHANGE\_METADATA | JSON | Optional object with details | {`
Rate Limit: 90 reqs/min (requests per minute)
`}
content.excerpt: Returns an array of all the current user's wallets.

post.description: Gets all the current user's active orders.

id.description: Allows you to retrieve specific orders by order ID (can be omitted to return all active orders).

gid.description: Filter results based on Group ID

cid.description: Filter based on Client ID. To use this, a cid_date must also be provided

cid_date.description: Provide alongside a cid to filter based on Client ID. Format: "YYYY-MM-DD"

post.description: Gets all the current user's active orders by trading pair symbol (e.g. tBTCUSD, tLTCBTC, ...).

parameters.name: symbol
parameters.description: The trading pair symbol you want to fetch the orders about (e.g. tBTCUSD, tLTCBTC, ...).

id.description: Allows you to retrieve specific orders by order ID (can be omitted to return all active orders).

gid.description: Filter results based on Group ID

cid.description: Filter based on Client ID. To use this, a cid_date must also be provided

cid_date.description: Provide alongside a cid to filter based on Client ID. Format: "YYYY-MM-DD"

post.description: Submits an order on a trading pair (e.g. BTCUSD, LTCBTC, ...).

type.description: The type of the order (see list above).

symbol.description: The trading pair symbol to submit the order on.

amount.description: Amount of order (positive for buy, negative for sell).

lev.description: Set the leverage for a derivative order, supported by derivative symbol orders only. The value should be between 1 and 100 inclusive. If omitted the default leverage value of 10 will be used.

price_trailing.description: The trailing price for a trailing stop order.

price_aux_limit.description: Auxiliary Limit price (only for STOP LIMIT).

cid.description: Client Order ID; should be unique in the day (UTC+0).

flags.description: The sum of all order flags (see https://docs.bitfinex.com/docs/flag-values).

tif.description: Time-In-Force: datetime for automatic order cancellation (e.g. 2020-01-15 10:45:23).

meta.description: Object to pass order meta data. Options: 'aff_code' (to pass affiliate codes), 'make_visible' (to toggle visible on hit for hidden orders), 'protect_selfmatch' (to cancel submitted order if it would match with one of your own orders). Example: meta: {aff_code: "AFF_CODE_HERE", make_visible: 1}

aff_code.description: Pass an affiliate code as a string

make_visible.description: Turn on 'visible on hit' for hidden orders (1 to enable)

post.description: Updates an existing order, can be used to update margin, exchange, and derivative orders.

id.description: The ID of the order to update (can be retrieved by calling the [Retrieve Orders](https://docs.bitfinex.com/reference#rest-auth-retrieve-orders) and the [Retrieve Orders (by symbol)](https://docs.bitfinex.com/reference#rest-auth-retrieve-orders-by-symbol) endpoints).

amount.description: Amount of order (positive for buy, negative for sell).

cid.description: Client Order ID; should be unique in the day (UTC+0).

flags.description: The sum of all order flags (see https://docs.bitfinex.com/docs/flag-values).

lev.description: Set the leverage for a derivative order, supported by derivative symbol orders only. The value should be between 1 and 100 inclusive. If omitted the default leverage value of 10 will be used.

delta.description: The delta to apply to the amount value.

price_aux_limit.description: Auxiliary Limit price (only for STOP LIMIT).

price_trailing.description: The trailing price for a trailing stop order.

tif.description: Time-In-Force: datetime for automatic order cancellation (e.g. 2020-01-15 10:45:23).

meta.description: Object to pass order meta data. Options: 'aff_code' (to pass affiliate codes), 'make_visible' (to toggle visible on hit for hidden orders), 'protect_selfmatch' (to cancel submitted order if it would match with one of your own orders). Example: meta: {aff_code: "AFF_CODE_HERE", make_visible: 1}

aff_code.description: Pass an affiliate code as a string

make_visible.description: Turn on 'visible on hit' for hidden orders (1 to enable)

post.description: Cancels one of the current user's orders.

id.description: The ID of the order to cancel (can be get using the [Retrieve Orders](https://docs.bitfinex.com/reference#rest-auth-retrieve-orders) and the [Retrieve Orders (by symbol)](https://docs.bitfinex.com/reference#rest-auth-retrieve-orders-by-symbol) endpoints).

cid.description: The CID of the order to cancel. Users must also provide a `cid_date` to cancel an order through its CID. Providing only the CID will cause the endpoint to return an error.

cid_date.description: An YYYY-MM-DD date to provide along with an order's CID.

post.description: Cancels multiple orders simultaneously. Orders can be canceled based on the Order ID, the combination of Client Order ID and Client Order Date, or the Group Order ID. Alternatively, the body param 'all' can be used with a value of 1 to cancel all orders.

id.description: An array containing the IDs of the orders to delete.

gid.description: An array containing the GIDs of the orders to delete.

cid.description: An array of tuples containing the cid and cid_date pairs of the orders to delete.

all.description: If set to 1, cancels all open orders  (both trading and derivative)

post.description: Retrieves all user's closed/cancelled orders up to 2 weeks in the past.

start.description: If start is given, only records with MTS_CREATE >= start (milliseconds) will be given as response.

end.description: If end is given, only records with MTS_CREATE <= end (milliseconds) will be given as response.

id.description: Allows users to retrieve specific orders by Order ID (id: [ID1, ID2, ID3]).

post.description: Retrieves all user's closed/cancelled orders up to 2 weeks in the past by trading pair symbol (e.g. tBTCUSD, tLTCBTC, ...).

parameters.name: symbol
parameters.description: The symbol for which to retrieve order history (e.g. tBTCUSD, tETHUSD, ...).

start.description: If start is given, only records with MTS_CREATE >= start (milliseconds) will be given as response.

end.description: If end is given, only records with MTS_CREATE <= end (milliseconds) will be given as response.

id.description: Allows users to retrieve specific orders by Order ID (id: [ID1, ID2, ID3]).

post.description: Get Trades generated by an Order. Valid for trades upto 10 days old.

parameters.name: symbol
parameters.description: The trading pair symbol for which to retrieve order trades (e.g. tBTCUSD, tETHUSD, ...).

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The ID of the order for which to retrieve order trades.

post.description: Retrieve your trades. Your most recent trades will be retrieved by default, but a timestamp can be used to retrieve time-specific data.

start.description: If start is given, only records with MTS >= start (milliseconds) will be given as response.

end.description: If start is given, only records with MTS <= end (milliseconds) will be given as response.

sort.description: +1: sort in ascending order | -1: sort in descending order (by MTS field).

post.description: Retrieve your trades by trading pair symbol (e.g. tBTCUSD, tLTCUSD, ...). Your most recent trades will be retrieved by default, but a timestamp can be used to retrieve time-specific data.

parameters.name: symbol
parameters.description: The symbol for which to retrieve trade history (e.g. tBTCUSD, tETHUSD, ...).

start.description: If start is given, only records with MTS >= start (milliseconds) will be given as response.

end.description: If start is given, only records with MTS <= end (milliseconds) will be given as response.

sort.description: +1: sort in ascending order | -1: sort in descending order (by MTS field).

post.description: Toggle to keep funding taken. Specify loan for unused funding and credit for used funding.

id.description: Pass an array of id's to toggle their keep funding status (on -> off, off -> on). If the changes object is also passed, keep funding status will change as specified in the changes object.

changes.description: Optional object to specify changes for each id (1 to enable, 0 to disable) ex. {1234: 1, 1235: 1, 1236: 0, ...}

amount.description: Amount to deposit from Bitfinex to Thalex

ccy.description: Currency to deposit to Thalex (allowed values: 'USE', 'ETH', 'BTC')

tfaToken.description: Provide a tfaToken object to validate the request with U2F 2FA

token.description: Only used when method is 'otp'. Provide otp as a string. (e.g. '123456')

response.description: Only used when method is 'u2f'. Used to pass assertion result. ([ref](https://webauthn-open-source.github.io/fido2-lib/Fido2Lib.html#assertionResult))

id.description: The base64url encoded id returned by the client

rawId.description: The base64url encoded rawId returned by the client. If res.rawId is missing, res.id will be used instead. If both are missing an error will be thrown.

clientDataJSON.description: The base64url encoded clientDataJSON returned by the client

attestationObject.description: The base64url encoded authenticatorData returned by the client

signature.description: The base64url encoded signature returned by the client

userHandle.description: The base64url encoded userHandle returned by the client. May be null or an empty string.

Result.value:
[
  "error",
  null,
  "ERR_WRONG_AMOUNT"
]

/*
List of possible errors

ERR_ERR_PROVIDER_UNK - wrong provider value
ERR_SVC_NOT_AVAILABLE - service temporary not available
ERR_NOT_FOUND_USER - user has not onboarded
ERR_NOT_ALLOWED - onboarding was not completed
ERR_CCY_UNK - ccy value is not supported
ERR_WRONG_AMOUNT - amount value has not passed validation
ERR_AMNT_TOO_SMALL - amount is too small
ERR_FAILED - failed to request deposit due to internal error
ERR_INTERNAL - failed to process request due to unexpected error

*/

amount.description: Amount to withdraw from Thalex to Bitfinex

ccy.description: Currency to withdraw from Thalex (allowed values: 'USE', 'ETH', 'BTC')

tfaToken.description: Provide a tfaToken object to validate the request with U2F 2FA

token.description: Only used when method is 'otp'. Provide otp as a string. (e.g. '123456')

response.description: Only used when method is 'u2f'. Used to pass assertion result. ([ref](https://webauthn-open-source.github.io/fido2-lib/Fido2Lib.html#assertionResult))

id.description: The base64url encoded id returned by the client

rawId.description: The base64url encoded rawId returned by the client. If res.rawId is missing, res.id will be used instead. If both are missing an error will be thrown.

clientDataJSON.description: The base64url encoded clientDataJSON returned by the client

attestationObject.description: The base64url encoded authenticatorData returned by the client

signature.description: The base64url encoded signature returned by the client

userHandle.description: The base64url encoded userHandle returned by the client. May be null or an empty string.

[
  "error",

  "ERR_WRONG_AMOUNT"
]

List of possible errors

ERR_ERR_PROVIDER_UNK - wrong provider value

*/

post.description: Get information about free transfers and their renewal. Users are eligible for two free deposits every 24 hours.

symbol.description: Trading pair for which you wish to change the funding type

type.description: Provide the desired funding type setting (0 for daily and 1 for term funding)

meta.description: Returns an array of all the current user's wallets.
meta.title: Wallets

rdmd.body:
### Response data | Index | Field | Type | Description | | :------- | :----- | :----------------------- | :--------------------------------------------------------- | | \[0...n] | WALLET | [Wallet](#wallet-arrays) | Each index contains one of the `n` current user's wallets. | #### Wallet arrays | Index | Field | Type | Description | | ----- | ---------------------- | ------ | ------------------------------------------------------- | | \[0] | TYPE | string | Wallet name (exchange, margin, funding) | | \[1] | CURRENCY | string | Currency (e.g. USD, BTC, ETH, ...) | | \[2] | BALANCE | float | Balance | | \[3] | UNSETTLED\_INTEREST | float | Unsettled interest | | \[4] | AVAILABLE\_BALANCE | float | Wallet balance available for orders/withdrawal/transfer | | \[5] | LAST\_CHANGE | string | Description of the last ledger entry | | \[6] | LAST\_CHANGE\_METADATA | JSON | Optional object with details | {`
Rate Limit: 90 reqs/min (requests per minute)
`}

dehydrated.body:
Response data

IndexFieldTypeDescription
[0...n]WALLETWalletEach index contains one of the n current user's wallets.

Wallet arrays

IndexFieldTypeDescription
[0]TYPEstringWallet name (exchange, margin, funding)
[1]CURRENCYstringCurrency (e.g. USD, BTC, ETH, ...)
[2]BALANCEfloatBalance
[3]UNSETTLED_INTERESTfloatUnsettled interest
[4]AVAILABLE_BALANCEfloatWallet balance available for orders/withdrawal/transfer
[5]LAST_CHANGEstringDescription of the last ledger entry
[6]LAST_CHANGE_METADATAJSONOptional object with details
Rate Limit: 90 reqs/min (requests per minute)

promos.title: Introduction
promos.text:
The Bitfinex API’s are designed to allow access to all of the features of the Bitfinex platform. The end goal is to allow people to potentially recreate the entire platform on their own.

If you would like to suggest changes to the documentation, please see the github at https://github.com/bitfinexcom/api_docs

# Open Source Libraries
The following open source projects are works in progress. We will be continually improving them, but we want to release them early so that the community can take a look, make use of them, and offer pull requests. Nothing in the Bitcoin world exists in isolation.

project.description: The Official Documentation for the Bitfinex API Reference.
